body_html:
The GMM part is encapsulated as part of an Estimator (see https://www.tensorflow.org/extend/estimators). Think of that as a wrapper where you define your model and then use the class method ".fit()" to do the training. That will run sess.run() for you. 2017-05-02 14:50 GMT-04:00 vinay-hebb <notifications@github.com>:
…

body_text:
The GMM part is encapsulated as part of an Estimator (see
https://www.tensorflow.org/extend/estimators). Think of that as a wrapper
where you define your model and then use the class method ".fit()" to do
the training. That will run sess.run() for you.

body:
The GMM part is encapsulated as part of an Estimator (see
https://www.tensorflow.org/extend/estimators). Think of that as a wrapper
where you define your model and then use the class method ".fit()" to do
the training. That will run sess.run() for you.
